Description: Lower wall fragment of a pottery closed vase, amphora (?); inside reserved; outside glazed with incised lotus flower and perhaps tongues with added red and white detail; two reserved lines above.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See Schlotzhauer 2011 for result of clay analysis, pointing to Teos as the origin.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 225, no. 119)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 257, no. 11)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 116, pl. XXXVI, no. 328.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GI.016)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 84, Nau 22, pl. 5d-e)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4708 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
